item.title: X, Part 3: Find Your Voice - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: We all have a STRONG HAND that represents the GIFTS God has given to you. We also have a WEAK HAND, and we think that DISQUALIFIES us from being used by God, but God’s POWER is made perfect in WEAKNESS. That is where God wants to ANOINT you.
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)
item.itunes:subtitle: We all have a STRONG HAND that represents the GIFTS God has given to you. We also have a WEAK HAND, and we think that DISQUALIFIES us from being used by God, but God’s POWER is made perfect in WEAKNESS. That is where God wants to ANOINT you.
item.itunes:author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)
item.itunes:summary: We all have a STRONG HAND that represents the GIFTS God has given to you. We also have a WEAK HAND, and we think that DISQUALIFIES us from being used by God, but God’s POWER is made perfect in WEAKNESS. That is where God wants to ANOINT you.

item.title: X, Part 2: Double Anointing - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: LEGACY is not what you accomplish. Legacy is what OTHERS ACCOMPLISH because of you. In science, it’s called a MENTORING CHAIN. In sports, it’s called a COACHING TREE. In the Bible, it’s called DISCIPLESHIP. Discipleship is GROWING FRUIT on other people’s trees!
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)
item.itunes:subtitle: LEGACY is not what you accomplish. Legacy is what OTHERS ACCOMPLISH because of you. In science, it’s called a MENTORING CHAIN. In sports, it’s called a COACHING TREE. In the Bible, it’s called DISCIPLESHIP. Discipleship is GROWING FRUIT on other people’s trees!
item.itunes:author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)

item.title: X, Part 1: Dare To Be Different - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description:
If you want to repeat history, do it the way it’s always been done.

If you want to make history, dare to be different.

The anointing is the X Factor.

The anointing is the IT Factor.

It’s time for a new anointing for a new season!
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)
item.itunes:subtitle: If you want to repeat history, do it the way it’s always been done. If you want to make history, dare to be different. The anointing is the X Factor. The anointing is the IT Factor. It’s time for a new anointing for a new season!
item.itunes:author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)
item.itunes:summary: If you want to repeat history, do it the way it’s always been done. If you want to make history, dare to be different. The anointing is the X Factor. The anointing is the IT Factor. It’s time for a new anointing for a new season!

item.title: Jesus, Part 15: Be A Witness - Pastor Jimeka Jones Setzer
item.description:
Mark 16:9-15 NIV
Our witness requires us to --
Believe the Good News
Recognize the Good News
Live the Good News
Share the Good News

item.title: Jesus, Part 12: Jesus Plus Nothing - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description:
Mark 12:10-11

Have you not read this passage of Scripture: The STONE the builders rejected has become the CORNERSTONE. The Lord has done this. And it is marvelous in our eyes.

item.title: Jesus, Part 4: The Power of a Single Seed - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: We want to do amazing things for God, but that isn’t our job. God is the One who does amazing things for us. Our job? To consecrate ourselves to God. And if we do our job, God will do His job. If we do little things like they’re big things, God will do big things like they’re little things!
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)
item.itunes:subtitle: We want to do amazing things for God, but that isn’t our job. God is the One who does amazing things for us. Our job? To consecrate ourselves to God. And if we do our job, God will do His job. If we do little things like they’re big things, God will do big things like they’re little things!

item.title: Holy, Part 1: Holy, Holy, Holy - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: We can’t not worship. All of us worship someone or something. Either we worship the One True God, or we settle for a substitute. The opposite of THEOLOGY is IDOLATRY. The purpose of THEOLOGY is DOXOLOGY. “A LOW VIEW of God is the cause of a hundred lesser evils,” said A.W. Tozer. “A HIGH VIEW of God is the solution to 10,000 temporal problems.”
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)
item.itunes:subtitle: We can’t not worship. All of us worship someone or something. Either we worship the One True God, or we settle for a substitute. The opposite of THEOLOGY is IDOLATRY. item.title: Seen Heard Loved, Part 1: Seen Heard Loved: The God Who Hears - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: God is bigger than big, God Most High. God is closer than close, God Most Nigh. He is the God who knows the hairs on your head. He is the God who knows your voice, loves your voice. He is the God who hears your groans and the God who groans for you. Make no mistake, your voice matters to God.
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)

item.title: Dream, Part 4: Dream: The Transformation Equation - Pastor Robb Schmidgall
item.description: Growth and progression are a part of how God made us, and it calls from deep within us all. Join us as we look at four perspectives that will greatly enhance our ongoing transformation as individuals and as a community.
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)

item.title: Dream, Part 3: Dream: Two-Foot Field Trip - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: The problem is not the problem. The problem is our perspective on the problem. The solution? A revival of perspective. It’s a vision of God, high and exalted. It’s getting a God’s eye view. It’s a heightened awareness of when and where and how God is working and moving all around us. We want God to change our circumstances. We want God to change other people. God wants to change us!
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)

item.title: Dream, Part 2: Dream: Return to Me - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: You can run, but you can’t hide. There is a God, the Hound of Heaven, who runs after us. All you have to do is turn around and you’ll find God with His arms wide open.
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)

item.title: Dream, Part 1: Dream: Even Now - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: Never put a period where God puts a comma. With God, it’s never too little and it’s never too late. He can feed 5,000 with 5 loaves and 2 fish. He can raise a man 4 days dead. To the Infinite, all finites are possible!
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)

item.title: Fear Not, Part 2: Fear Not: Hope is Risky Business - Pastor Heather Zempel
item.description: God's promise to Zechariah and Elizabeth seemed like it came too late. In the face of disappointment, they played the long game. In the face of a promise delayed, they dared to hope again. Meanwhile, God was setting the stage for his kingdom to invade earth.
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)

item.title: Fear Not, Part 1: Fear Not: Ego is the Enemy - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: When people react in a way that is out of proportion to the situation at hand, they aren’t reacting to you. They are reacting from past hurt. They are reacting out of ego. How do we fly above the fray? How do we act, and react, like Jesus? 1) Overlook the offense 2) Check your ego at the door 3) Don’t let fear dictate your decisions.
item.itunes:keywords: NCC, Mark Batterson, National Community Church, Washington, DC, Church, Sermon
item.author: podcast@theaterchurch.com (National Community Church)
item.itunes:subtitle: When people react in a way that is out of proportion to the situation at hand, they aren’t reacting to you. They are reacting from past hurt. They are reacting out of ego. item.title: Welcome Home, Part 4: House of Miracles - Dr. Mark Batterson
item.description: Our church home is a PLACE OF MIRACLES, place of prayer, place of worship, place of belonging, place of purpose and so much more. No matter where you’ve been or where you're headed, we’ve got a seat for you at the table, and you’re right on time. Welcome Home.
